Detailed Description

Class that represents a Globally Unique Identifier for RTTI.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

DzGuid::DzGuid (  ) 

Default constructor. Creates a 'nil' GUID {00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000}.

DzGuid::DzGuid ( unsigned int  data1,
unsigned short  data2,
unsigned short  data3,
unsigned char  data4_0,
unsigned char  data4_1,
unsigned char  data4_2,
unsigned char  data4_3,
unsigned char  data4_4,
unsigned char  data4_5,
unsigned char  data4_6,
unsigned char  data4_7 
)

Numeric constructor. Creates a GUID from its numeric parts.

Parameters:
data1 The 4 bytes that make up the first data field of the GUID
data2 The 2 bytes that make up the second field of the GUID
data3 The 2 bytes that make up the third field of the GUID
data4_0 Byte 0 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_1 Byte 1 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_2 Byte 2 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_3 Byte 3 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_4 Byte 4 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_5 Byte 5 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_6 Byte 6 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_7 Byte 7 of the fourth data field of the GUID
Example:
The GUID {D208FBE5-01D5-4bc2-A973-8D3D94D1FFF8} could be created this way as:
    DzGuid  myGUID( 0xD208FBE5, 0x01D5, 0x4bc2, 0xA9, 0x73, 0x8D, 0x3D, 0x94, 0xD1, 0xFF, 0xF8 );

DzGuid DzGuid::fromCString ( const char *  cstr  )  [static]

Creates a GUID from a string representation.

Parameters:
cstr A NULL-terminated string representation of the GUID in the format "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX" or "{XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX}"
Returns:
The GUID created from the string.
DzGuid DzGuid::fromLegacyClassID ( unsigned int  classID  )  [static]

Creates a GUID from a legacy class ID.

Parameters:
classID The class ID to create a GUID from. This becomes the first data field of the GUID, the rest of the data fields are set to zero.
Returns:
The new GUID.

unsigned short  data2,

unsigned char  data4_0,
unsigned char  data4_1,
unsigned char  data4_2,
unsigned char  data4_3,
unsigned char  data4_4,
unsigned char  data4_5,
unsigned char  data4_6,
unsigned char  data4_7 
)

Sets the data of the GUID.

Parameters:
data1 The 4 bytes that make up the first data field of the GUID
data2 The 2 bytes that make up the second field of the GUID
data3 The 2 bytes that make up the third field of the GUID
data4_0 Byte 0 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_1 Byte 1 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_2 Byte 2 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_3 Byte 3 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_4 Byte 4 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_5 Byte 5 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_6 Byte 6 of the fourth data field of the GUID
data4_7 Byte 7 of the fourth data field of the GUID
Example:
The GUID {D208FBE5-01D5-4bc2-A973-8D3D94D1FFF8} could be created this way as:
    DzGuid  myGUID;
    
    myGUID.setData( 0xD208FBE5, 0x01D5, 0x4bc2, 0xA9, 0x73, 0x8D, 0x3D, 0x94, 0xD1, 0xFF, 0xF8 );

QString DzGuid::toString (  )  const

Returns:

QString DzGuid::toString ( const DzGuid &  guid  )  [static]

Creates a string representation of a GUID

Parameters:
The GUID to convert to a string
Returns:
A string representation of the GUID in the format "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX"

QString DzGuid::toString( const DzGuid &guid ) { int i; char guidStr[37]; char *strIt = guidStr;

for( i = 0; i < 8; i++ ){ if( i == 4 || i == 6 ){ strIt = '-'; strIt++; }

int shift = (7 - i) * 8;

strIt = char( (guid.m_data.m_values[0] >> (shift + 4)) & 0x0f ); if( *strIt < 10 ) strIt += '0'; else strIt += 'A' - 10; strIt++;

strIt = char( (guid.m_data.m_values[0] >> shift) & 0x0f ); if( *strIt < 10 ) strIt += '0'; else strIt += 'A' - 10; strIt++; }

strIt = '-'; strIt++;

for( i = 0; i < 8; i++ ){ if( i == 2 ){ strIt = '-'; strIt++; }

int shift = (7 - i) * 8;

strIt = char( (guid.m_data.m_values[1] >> (shift + 4)) & 0x0f ); if( *strIt < 10 ) strIt += '0'; else strIt += 'A' - 10; strIt++;

strIt = char( (guid.m_data.m_values[1] >> shift) & 0x0f ); if( *strIt < 10 ) strIt += '0'; else strIt += 'A' - 10; strIt++; }

strIt = 0;

return QString( guidStr ); }

/** Creates a string representation of a GUID

Parameters:
The GUID to convert to a string
Returns:
A string representation of the GUID in the format "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX"
